description: Circle packing problem through ADMM optimization algorithm.
README.md:
Circle Packing Problem through ADMM Algorithm
=============================================

We provide a simple implementation of the Alternating Direction Method
of Multipliers (ADMM) algorithm to solve convex optimization problems.

We apply this algorithm to the circle packing problem 
(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Circle_packing). The goal is to
fit equal radius circles, without overlap, into a box. 
The ADMM algorithm can be easily parallelized. 
A distributed implementation was provided in 
http://arxiv.org/abs/1305.1961.


Description
-----------

We solve

    minimize 1
    subject to (x_i - x_j)^2 + (y_i - y_j)^2 > 4R^2, R <= x_i, y_i <= L - R
               for i, j = 1, 2, ..., N.

Here R is the radius of the balls and L the size of a square box.


Simulations
-----------

Check the results of the simulation runned by this code in the following
links:

https://github.com/guisf/circle_packing/tree/master/videos/4balls.mp4

https://github.com/guisf/circle_packing/tree/master/videos/15balls.mp4

https://github.com/guisf/circle_packing/tree/master/videos/23balls.mp4
